are you talking about tsclient or vino-server?
well, you can allow client to connect but not control your desktop. you can set password as well
but you can also allow them to see but not touch
you need to set realvnc to connect as VNC and not RDP
it supports both as far as i can remember
and in "server" you should put "ip.address:0" i think. it was a while ago i used it (a couple of years)
ah no you're right. it uses 5900 as standard

nope. vino and normal vnc runs on 5900. BUT vino-server only starts when a user logs in to gnome so only port 5900 is in use. for a "normal" vnc server like tightvnc the server is started for each screen (5901, 5902 etc)
